alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 14 at 2:27PM MST until March 16 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Arizona... Verde River above Clarkdale affecting Yavapai County. .Heavy rainfall overnight through Wednesday into Thursday morning combined with enhanced snowmelt will lead to elevated flow in and possible minor flooding of the Verde River near Clarkdale. For the Verde River near Clarkdale elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING TO EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Verde River near Clarkdale. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening to early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, High flow could lead to bank erosion and water ponding in backwater catch basins. At 12.0 feet, Nuisance flooding of property along riverbanks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM MST Tuesday the stage was 5.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will be at 5.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise to a crest of 10.9 feet early Thursday morning. It will fall to 3.4 feet by Sunday morning. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Verde River Clarkdale 12.0 5.8 Tue 1 pm MST 6.3 9.1 6.1 &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz The next statement will be issued no later than Thursday morning at 1100 AM MST.
